title: How to Make Muffins Without Eggs

steps.headline: Place the bowl on a counter or table.
Add the baking powder, sugar, chocolate powder (optional), and salt.
Mix well with a fork or whisk
Add the butter to the dry ingredients; mix well with a metal fork or your hands until creamed.
steps.description: Optional: Add the raisins, seeds, chocolate chips etc.

steps.headline: Set the muffins dye stand into the pressure cooker with 4 cups (950 ml) of water on the base of cooker.
Smear a little butter on the base and walls of muffin cups.
Pour the batter into the cups of muffins pan.
steps.description: One-half cup is the right amount per cup.

steps.headline: Place the batter-filled muffin pan in cooker, and close as directed in cooker's instruction manual.
When the time is up, smell the steam coming from the cooker and switch it off.
Open the lid of cooker and check by sticking  a toothpick into a muffin to make sure the inside is cooked.
steps.description: If the toothpick comes out clean, they're done; if not, cook for another 10 more minutes.

steps.headline: Remove from cooker, transfer muffins to serving dish and enjoy.

tyn: Muffin or cupcake pan with stand (like idly stand)
text: Place the bowl on a counter or table.  Pour the flour into it.  Add the baking powder, sugar, chocolate powder (optional), and salt.  Mix well with a fork or whisk  Add the butter to the dry ingredients; mix well with a metal fork or your hands until creamed. Optional: Add the raisins, seeds, chocolate chips etc. Set the muffins dye stand into the pressure cooker with 4 cups (950 ml) of water on the base of cooker.  Smear a little butter on the base and walls of muffin cups.  Pour the batter into the cups of muffins pan. One-half cup is the right amount per cup. Preheat the cooker for 5 minutes.  Place the batter-filled muffin pan in cooker, and close as directed in cooker's instruction manual.  Steam for 25-30 minutes.  When the time is up, smell the steam coming from the cooker and switch it off.  Allow steam to subside.  Open the lid of cooker and check by sticking  a toothpick into a muffin to make sure the inside is cooked. If the toothpick comes out clean, they're done; if not, cook for another 10 more minutes. Remove from cooker, transfer muffins to serving dish and enjoy.
